alert.note: Alert for Christian; Coles; Cumberland; Douglas; Effingham; Moultrie; Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 16 at 3:07PM CST until February 17 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Areas of flooding caused by excessive rainfall on frozen soil. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois, east central Illinois and southeast Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Christian, Macon, Piatt and Shelby. In east central Illinois, Champaign, Clark, Coles, Cumberland, Douglas, Edgar, Moultrie and Vermilion. In southeast Illinois, Clay, Crawford, Effingham, Jasper, Lawrence and Richland. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall amounts of 2 inches or more are expected tonight and Thursday, before the rain changes to an icy mixture and then to snow. The heaviest rain is expected south of I-70.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Christian; Coles; Cumberland; Douglas; Effingham; Moultrie; Shelby
